reasoning: Calcium oxalate stones comprise ~80% of all kidney stones. Total kidney stone incidence approximately 150 per 100k person-years in developed countries, so calcium oxalate subset ~120 per 100k.
source: Stamatelou KK et al. (2003). Time trends in reported prevalence of kidney stones in the United States: 1976-1994. Kidney Int. 63(5):1817-1823
